semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for COVID-19 Underimmunization Status
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Chapter 1: Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > g. Coronavirus infections > 1. COVID-19 infections > n. Underimmunization for COVID-19 Status

content.full_text: Code Z28.310, Unvaccinated for COVID-19, may be assigned when the patient has not received a COVID-19 vaccine of any type. Code Z28.311, Partially vaccinated for COVID-19, may be assigned when the patient has been partially vaccinated for COVID-19 as per the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) in place at the time of the encounter. For information, visit the CDC's website https://www.cdc.gov/covidschedule. See Section I.B.14. for underimmunization documentation by clinicians other than patient's provider. (Evidence: pg no: 32, L66-L70)
content.summary: Provides coding instructions for COVID-19 vaccination status, including unvaccinated and partially vaccinated patients, with reference to CDC guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 32, L66-L70)
key_concepts: Unvaccinated status coding with Z28.310 (Evidence: pg no: 32, L66-L68)
Partially vaccinated status coding with Z28.311 (Evidence: pg no: 32, L68-L69)
CDC recommendations reference (Evidence: pg no: 32, L68-L69)
Documentation by other clinicians reference (Evidence: pg no: 32, L70)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Z28.310 for unvaccinated COVID-19 patients (Evidence: pg no: 32, L66-L68)
detailed_rules.explanation: Code Z28.310 may be assigned when the patient has not received a COVID-19 vaccine of any type (Evidence: pg no: 32, L66-L68)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Z28.311 for partially vaccinated COVID-19 patients per CDC recommendations (Evidence: pg no: 32, L68-L69)
detailed_rules.explanation: Code Z28.311 may be assigned when the patient has been partially vaccinated for COVID-19 as per CDC recommendations in place at the time of the encounter (Evidence: pg no: 32, L68-L69)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine patient's COVID-19 vaccination status
Step 2: Compare to current CDC recommendations
Step 4: Assign Z28.311 if partially vaccinated per CDC guidelines
Step 5: Reference CDC website for current recommendations

specific_codes.description: Unvaccinated for COVID-19 (Evidence: pg no: 32, L66-L67)
specific_codes.context: For patients who have not received any COVID-19 vaccine

breakdown.Z28: Immunization not carried out and underimmunization status

specific_codes.description: Partially vaccinated for COVID-19 (Evidence: pg no: 32, L68)
specific_codes.context: For patients partially vaccinated per CDC recommendations

breakdown.Z28: Immunization not carried out and underimmunization status

references_to.title: Underimmunization documentation by clinicians other than patient's provider
references_to.explanation: Referenced for documentation requirements by other clinicians

coding_scenarios.scenario: Unvaccinated patient presents with COVID-19 infection
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient with COVID-19, reports never received any COVID-19 vaccination
step_by_step: Step 1: Confirm patient has not received any COVID-19 vaccine
Step 2: Assign primary diagnosis for COVID-19 (U07.1)
Step 3: Assign Z28.310 as additional diagnosis

correct_coding.sequencing: COVID-19 first, vaccination status as additional
correct_coding.rationale: Vaccination status provides important epidemiological information (Evidence: pg no: 32, L66-L68)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with incomplete COVID-19 vaccination series per CDC guidelines
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient received initial COVID-19 vaccine series but missing recommended booster per current CDC guidelines
step_by_step: Step 2: Compare to current CDC recommendations
Step 3: Determine patient is partially vaccinated

correct_coding.sequencing: Vaccination status as additional diagnosis when relevant
correct_coding.rationale: Partial vaccination status per CDC guidelines documented (Evidence: pg no: 32, L68-L69)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Patient is not unvaccinated, but partially vaccinated
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Confusing partially vaccinated with unvaccinated status

warnings: Vaccination status must be determined per CDC recommendations at time of encounter (Evidence: pg no: 32, L68-L69)
best_practices: Reference current CDC website for vaccination recommendations (Evidence: pg no: 32, L69)
Consider documentation requirements for other clinicians (Evidence: pg no: 32, L70)
common_mistakes: Confusing unvaccinated with partially vaccinated status
tips: CDC recommendations may change over time
implementation_notes: Establish protocols for checking current CDC recommendations
Train staff on vaccination status determination
